main event: A visual observation of a very cigar-cloud-like object with a mist or cloud surrounding it at Dayton Airport, Ohio, on April 4, 1958.
interesting points: The object appeared to be 6 to 8 feet in diameter and traveled at approximately 50 miles per hour, very low to the ground, without any noise or exhaust observed.
A report was filled out in the form of a questionnaire designed to gather detailed information about the observed unidentified flying object (UFO).

The observers were considered professional, the people involved in the report became genuinely excited, and there was a good chance of the sighting being a reality, according to the U.S. Air Force conclusions.
The report indicated that the information provided by the observers would be used for research purposes and treated as confidential material.
The sighting was accompanied by a request for personal information from the observers, with the possibility of further contact for additional details.
sighted object: Cigar-cloud-like object with a mist or cloud surrounding it
